entry.title: Add unit tests to base::mac::LaunchApplication.
entry.content:
Before adding more functionality to this method to support some PWA

notification use cases, this CL adds the framework for testing this

method as well as implements some tests for most of the existing

functionality.



In order for the added tests to not be flaky, this also moves a

workaround for a bug in the underlying OS APIs is from web-app

usage of this method to LaunchApplication itself. On macOS 11 and 12,

sometimes the launch API claims the launch failed despite actually

having a successful launch. This is detected by scanning the

running applications for one matching the launch attempt.



Bug: 938661

Change-Id: I820a7e86a5e8ac7ed13e823a3aee9f00f54b2ebb

entry.title: Consolidate all Omnibox ImageFetcher uses under one histogram.
entry.content:
We're in the process of enabling Image decorations for all of the

Omnibox suggestions. As such, the concept of Answer- and Entity images

is no longer going to stay as the only distinction.



We can either multiply histograms and identify every single suggestion

type as ImageFetcher client (most of these would report no data most

of the time) or consolidate them under `Omnibox' histogram (which is

what this change proposes).



Bug: 1468402

transaction interface. It was previously owned by

simplified and the object can be self-owned.

parameters/member variables.

entry.title: Allow overriding source in install-sysroot.py
entry.content:
In vendor builds it is quite common to have a custom sysroot image,

and currently the only way to use one is to patch Chromium, there are

already 3 flavors that I directly maintains:



* Electron

* Microsoft's internal build of Electron

* Yue (a GUI library)



It wouldn't surprise me if Slack and Discord also has their own patches

on the sysroot scripts.



This change allows overriding the path of sysroots.json file in vendor

build's DEPS file, and moves the URL of sysroot image to the

sysroots.json file.



Change-Id: I4be9c76464e1d69d0c9700c9422f3bc244448491

entry.title: Add Welcome Tour param for counterfactual experiment arms.
entry.content:
Counterfactual experiment arms will not run the Welcome Tour but will

log an UMA metric just before they would have otherwise run the tour if

not prevented from doing so.



This will be used in data analysis to compare impact against arms which

do run the Welcome Tour since the samples will be of similar sizes. The

control arm of the experiment will be disproportionately large and so

not suitable for cross-arm comparison.



Bug: b:294120972

entry.title: Reland "Deprecated shutdown metrics V1"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 6a5b8a2bf336fa05dd1fdba5086f6f011ff44e86



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS="Shutdown Metrics V1 are replaced by Shutdown Metrics V2"



Original change's description:

> Deprecated shutdown metrics V1

>

> The V1 set of metrics were using the local state prefs to keep

> the shutdown metrics until the next startup where they will be

> reported.

>

> A recent change in Chrome fixed the persistent memory for metrics.

> This means that UMA metrics macros are now working during shutdown.

>

> The V2 metrics are landed for months and are stable. We can deprecate

> the V1 set of metrics.

>

> Deprecate UMA metrics:

> * Shutdown.NotValid.Time

> * Shutdown.SilentExit.Time

> * Shutdown.WindowClose.Time

> * Shutdown.BrowserExit.Time

> * Shutdown.EndSession.Time

> * Shutdown.OtherExit.Time

>

> Deprecate the shutdown time file:

> * chrome_shutdown_ms.txt

>

> Deprecate local state prefs:

> * shutdown.num_processes

> * shutdown.num_processes_slow"

>

> OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS="Shutdown Metrics V1 are replaced by Shutdown Metrics V2"

>

Previously, code that touched variants used a lot of get_if, which meant

pointers-to-pointers and confusing code.



Now, the code explicitly uses the absl::visit(base:Overloaded{})

pattern, which is a more modern and more concise way to handle variants.



Also:

- Remove unnecessary includes

- Change AbsoluteLocation from using Point* to `std::ref(Point)` to

be consistent with other by-reference arguments in Kombucha



(The Point* thing was an oversight from the std::ref upgrade.)

entry.title: IndexedDB: remove an extra trip to task queue when firing result events.
entry.content:
See bug for overview of problem and performance results of this fix.



This patch removes the extra async step when returning a result via

IDBRequest. Results are returned via event dispatch, so this is

accomplished by removing the use of an EventQueue.



The IndexedDB spec often requires algorithms to “queue a task” which

forces asynchronocity. It also requires that “Requests must be executed

in the order in which they were made against the transaction.” IDB

results are returned via event dispatch. To enforce these two

requirements of asynchronicty and ordering, the events were always added

to an EventQueue. This is generally not necessary because:



* User actions that round trip through the browser process are already

asynchronous (and responses are handled on the appropriate task

queue)

* Browser-side logic processes and returns requests in the order in

which they are created. Later, in Blink, IDBTransaction keeps an

ordered list of returned results (a list of IDBRequestQueueItems)

as they are processed. Thus ordering is maintained.



The meat of this change is the removal of various `QueueEvent` methods

and replacement with direct event dispatch. In the cases where there is

not already a round trip through the browser process (such as

`cursor.advance()` when values have been prefetched), or an algorithm

explicitly requires some steps be synchronous while other steps are

async (such as `transaction.abort()`, which immediately cancels all

requests but asynchronously resets requests' attributes and dispatches

events), we explicitly post tasks to the appropriate queue.



The IDB spec interleaves synchronous and asynchronous steps in its

algorithms. For example, `cursor.advance()` will immediately set the

request’s `readyState` to ‘pending’ but asynchronously dispatch the

result. There are many WPT that verify event ordering and other details

of these algorithms which indicate that these changes are safe.



Along with these functional changes comes some slight refactoring and

renaming.

* The term “Enqueue” was heavily overloaded, and is often no longer

accurate, so it is changed to "Send" in a bunch of places.

* For clarity, function names generally become more unique.

* Some virtuals that were no longer necessary were removed

(IDBFactoryClient knows its request is an IDBOpenRequest)

* For simplicity and consistency, requests are always sent to their

transaction’s result_list_, even if they don’t require async

processing.



Fixed: 965136



Change-Id: I107459148ce8253b16507095f8d22ccc737c4df1

entry.title: [A11y] Don't defer any events while the tree is frozen
entry.content:
When tree is frozen/serializing, all work should be complete, which

also means no new work should be generated by processing the tree. This CL avoids a situation where cached values are invalidated and

recomputed while serializing, which could cause a tree restructuring

at an awkward time.

entry.title: [CodeHealth] Unify attribute maps in `PointerEventFactory`.
entry.content:
To be able to find the pointer-id for a `click` event for which the

corresponding pointer could be gone from PointerEventFactory, we need

to (temporarily) store removed pointers in a separate list. Before

adding the separate list (in a follow-up CL), this CL makes a no-op

change to unify all pointer attributes (including positions) into a

single map keyed by pointer-id.

- Rename `pointer_id_mapping_` to `pointer_id_to_attributes_`.

- Move pointer position data in maps `*last_position_mapping_` to

within `pointer_id_to_attributes_` map.

- Rewrite `typedef struct X {} X` to C++ style `struct X {}`.

- Add missing braces in multi-line `if`s.

entry.title: [TTF] Fix the crash in
entry.content:
KeyboardReplacingSurfaceVisibilityControllerImpl::Reset



The KeyboardReplacingSurfaceVisibilityController is a long living

object, which lifetime is tied to the tab. RenderWidgetHost is a shorter

living object which is created and destroyed per frame. This means that

storing a raw pointer to the RenderWidgetHost in the controller is

dangerous and causes SEGFAULT crashes. This CL injects a WeakPtr to the

ContentPasswordManagerDriver into the controller, which can be checked

for null before accessing it. The RenderWidgetHost can be accessed from

entry.title: Reland "Cookie Settings: Do not add lifetime to incognito exceptions"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 22a18a337a2490ea230714f3cc7957ee55172da5



Original reverted due to clash with UB exception scope change. Only

a minor tweak required for relanding.



Original change's description:

> Cookie Settings: Do not add lifetime to incognito exceptions

>

> When creating a User Bypass exception, do not set an expiration if the

> associated profile is incognito. Incognito exceptions are cleared at the

> end of the session anyway.

>

> Making this change within CookieSettings means that the various UI

> surfaces which display the expiration now display the exception as

> permanent.

>

> While this is not as good as a dedicated "This only lasts in incognito"

> string, it's much better than the current "Expires in X days".

>

entry.title: Reland: crosier: Add base class InteractiveAshTest for ash-chrome tests
entry.content:
Base class for tests of ash-chrome integration with the ChromeOS

platform, like hardware daemons, graphics, kernel, etc.



Sets up Kombucha for ash testing:

- Provides 1 Kombucha "context" per display, shared by all

views::Widgets

- Provides a default "context widget" so Kombucha can synthesize mouse

events

- Suppresses creating a browser window on startup, because most

ash-chrome tests don't need the window and creating it slows down

the test



Tests using this base class can be added to "chromeos_integration_tests"

to run on devices under test (DUTs) and virtual machines (VMs). Also, if

a test only communicates with OS daemons via D-Bus then the test can

also run in the linux-chromeos "emulator" in "interactive_ui_tests". The

latter approach makes it simpler to write the initial version of a test,

which can then be added to "chromeos_integration_tests" to also run on

DUT/VM.



Because this class derives from InProcessBrowserTest the source files

must be added to a target that defines HAS_OUT_OF_PROC_TEST_RUNNER. The

source files cannot be in a shared test support target that lacks that

define.



Changes from original CL:

- Close the browsers asynchronously to avoid mutating the BrowserList

while iterating over it.



Bug: b:291732302

Test: interactive_ui_tests --gtest_filter=InteractiveAshTestUITest.Basics

Test: out_betty/Release/run_chromeos_integration_tests # VM

Test: out_dedede/Release/run_chromeos_integration_tests # DUT

entry.title: [OOBE][CHOOBE] Fix early return issue in Screen::ShouldBeSkipped methods
entry.content:
In general, It's not correct to assume that when

`ChoobeFlowController::ShouldScreenBeSkipped()` returns false the

screen should be shown, but rather, the screen shouldn't be skipped

for ChoobeFlowController reasons.



So, in calls to `ChoobeFlowController::ShouldScreenBeSkipped()`, from

`Screen::ShouldBeSkipped()` methods, only return early if the method

returns true, otherwise, continue with the remaining checks.

entry.title: SyncService::Initialize: Remove last IsActiveAccountInfoFullyLoaded check
entry.content:
These checks were intended to ensure that the signin state is actually

known. However, recent metrics (see crbug.com/1454037) show that the

signin state is known even when IsActiveAccountInfoFullyLoaded() is

false (i.e. when refresh tokens haven't been loaded yet).



A similar change (removing this check) was previously made in

crrev.com/c/4632822 but had to be reverted due to an oddity in how

ChromeOS-Ash initializes new profiles.

This CL excludes the relevant code path on ChromeOS-Ash, since the

relevant functionality (user signing out) doesn't even exist on that

platform.

entry.title: mac: Use 4MB UDIF (.dmg) chunks when using ULMO (LZMA) compression
entry.content:
The default UDIF chunk size is 2048 blocks, where UDIF blocks are 512

bytes long, equaling 1MB. The LZMA compressor is more efficient when fed

more data, and the OS appears to fully support LZMA-compressed disk

images with UDIF chunks as large as 4MB, or 8192 blocks.



GoogleChromeCanary.dmg (117.0.5923.0) sizes, original and recompressed

as ULMO (with LZMA) at the default and various other UDIF chunk sizes:



243221764 original (like below, but with a signature added)

243209582 -format UDBZ -imagekey bzip2-level=9

209080447 -format ULMO

209080447 -format ULMO -imagekey udif-chunk-size=2048

200576796 -format ULMO -imagekey udif-chunk-size=8192



For an 8MB (4%) reduction relative to standard ULMO with 1MB chunks,

these 4MB chunks can be used for ULMO. When this compression is enabled

(which isn't happening in this change), it will result in a a 40MB (20%)

reduction relative to the current UDBZ.

entry.title: [sticky] Propagate sticky-descendants within fragment tree.
entry.content:
Previously we'd need to perform a full tree-walk of the paint-layer

tree to update our sticky-position constraints.

This was done in UpdateLayerPositionsAfterLayout.



This (currently) consumes 0.1-0.3% of renderer CPU time (depending on

platform etc - it was 2-3x this but we've slowly improved it!).



Instead of performing a full tree-walk:

1. Propagate our sticky descendants up the fragment-tree.

2. If a scrollable-area has any sticky-descendants, register the

scrollable-area for a post-layout update.

3. Update the constraints for the desired areas in post-layout.



Propagating the sticky-descendants in this way means we don't need

to perform any bookkeeping when sticky-descendants get added removed.



Bug: 752095

Change-Id: Ie18739e24f32f93b0974e23ae2a3ad0972bbe38b

entry.title: Make AutofillSuggestionTriggerSource available to DidShowSuggestions().
entry.content:
Suggestions are triggered like this:

1) BAM::OnAskForValuesToFillImpl()

2) AutofillExternalDelegate::OnSuggestionsReturned()

3) AutofillClient::ShowAutofillPopup()

4) AutofillExternalDelegate::OnPopupShown()

5) BAM::DidShowSuggestions().



In this process, the AutofillSuggestionTriggerSource describes what

caused the popup to appear - e.g. clicking into a field, clicking the

down array, selecting manual fallbacks through the context menu, etc.

Currently, the trigger source is only available in steps 1-3. It's also

stored in the popup for crrev.com/c/4679168.



Notably, the trigger source is not available in step 5. This is

relevant, because some funnel metrics are conditioned on

BAM::OnDidShowSuggestions(). For manual fallbacks, it was decided to

introduce a manual fallback specific FillAfterSuggestion funnel metric

[1]. In order to implement that, DidShowSuggestions() needs to be able

to distinguish by the trigger source.



This CL adds a trigger source parameter to DidShowSuggestions(),

updates all the references in tests (the majority of the delta) and

plumps the trigger source through.

The parameter is not used by this CL, but will be used by the follow-up

crrev.com/c/4733571 to implement said metric.



To plump the trigger source through, three options are:

1) Storing the trigger source in the external delegate.

2) Asking the popup for the trigger source in the external delegate.

3) Passing the trigger source to OnPopupShown().



This CL goes with approach 1, because it seems most consistent with

the existing code base (existing fields of the external delegate like has_autofill_suggestions_ could be derived from the popup as well, but

are not).



In tests, the trigger source kFormControlElementClicked is used, which

is the most common way to trigger Autofill suggestions.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Lb346eaee6GfQ6iDbPH44hz_VwyPcpj9Pj-2O2TK9vE/edit?resourcekey=0-hW0oTZZhhiGLiQEu81ptfA#heading=h.mowtw87e7p2c



Bug: 1446318

Change-Id: I7d6656f2a30e556557b1def896067fa79cd6d57f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4733376

Reviewed-by: Jan Keitel

Code-Coverage: Findit

entry.content:
These functions use `ui_controls::SendMouse*NotifyWhenDone()`

internally, which allow specifying a window hint:

> The `window_hint` - if specified - helps the method correctly target

> the appropriate window on platforms where mouse events must be

> explicitly targeted.



To enable more usage of `SendMouse*Sync()` on these platforms, we should

allow passing a window hint, which will be forwarded to `ui_controls`.

entry.title: Revert "arc: Implement scale factor request"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 7c1787d488a73f708c5056b0aa32569f3f9106aa.



Reason for revert: Broke arc.StandardizedMouseHover on some P devices



Original change's description:

> arc: Implement scale factor request

>

> Partly analogous to Lacros change: crrev.com/c/4034899.

>

> With this CL, ClientControlledShellSurface switches to

> scale factor request model.

>

> - This CL removes `scale_`, `pending_scale_`, GetScale(), and

> CommitPendingScale() defined in ClientControlledShellSurface,

> which contributes to reduce duplication of similar logic.

>

> - As ARC R+ requests bounds in pixels, Exo converts them to DP, but

> as the scale factor requested for these bounds-related requests

> are effective in the next commit, ClientControlledShellSurface

> needs access to the pending scale in ShellSurfaceHost to do the

> proper conversion. (This assumes that ARC sends the next scale

> factor before bounds requests.)

>

> Bug: b/290565343

> Bug: b/276985752

> Test: Manually test multi-display with ARC P/R/T

> Change-Id: If59c08ec635e0af96d8db9d2fc69bda03e6e6293

entry.title: [A11y] Ignore the aria-checked if equivalent HTML attribute is present
entry.content:
According to the HTML-AAM spec[1], prioritize the value of the native

input element in the checkbox or radio state includes both the checked

attribute and the aria-checked attribute with a valid value, or native

element without checked attribute has an implicit false state.



[1]: https://www.w3.org/TR/html-aam-1.0/#html-attribute-state-and-property-mappings



Signed-off-by: Hunseop Jeong

entry.title: Ignore the readonly when contentEditable and readonly=true are present

According to the HTML-AAM[1], the user agents must expose only the

contentEditable state if the element is set to contentEditable and

entry.title: Move disabling of WebView Connection Migration
entry.content:
* Previously, Connection migration was disabled through `disableIfNotSet` which prevented experimenting on that feature. This change uses

field trials to disable connection migration. Disable Overrides are always loaded after server/client trials which means that it will only

disable connection migration if the trial seed does not mention this feature otherwise it will use the value from the seed.

entry.title: Printing: Better width/height media query evaluation.
entry.content:
ResizeForPrinting() in PrepareFrameAndViewForPrint temporarily changed

the size of the frame as an attempt to affect the media query evaluation

code in Blink. But there are better ways. Just add some awareness to

Blink, and remove ResizeForPrinting() and RestoreSize().



Note that we still use sizes based on the page *area*, and not the page

*box*, but now without being affected by any @page size and margins, as

suggested by the spec, although the spec says to use the page *box* size

(i.e. including margins). This approach has some interoperability.

Discussion: https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/5437



Namedropping https://crbug.com/734815, since there are complaints there

about the behavior of ResizeForPrinting().



Bug: 1117050, 734815

Change-Id: Ifd18c53b581380cffd807540aa2bfacfb8e0eca1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4727725

Reviewed-by: Ian Kilpatrick

entry.title: Quick Delete: Add loading state for browsing history row
entry.content:
This change displays "Calculating..." in the browsing history row while

the data is being fetched asynchronously. The row is then updated with

the correct values when the data is ready.

The strings are not yet finalized.



It also fixes small bugs related to the dialog that I found along the

way, like the browsing history title count template not being updated

with every time period change, and the initial time period trigger

(Last 15 minutes) when the dialog is first displayed being called

twice, leading to some janky UX behaviour in the dialog especially in

cases where there is a delay.



Demo: https://drive.google.com/file/d/19p39n64Nn4bmNT3fivLB2lqswdZkYiRv/view?usp=sharing

Bug: 1412087, b/293281041

entry.title: [FastCheckout] Fix TriggerOutcome metric.
entry.content:
Before this CL, the metric TriggerOutcome was reported on

FCClientImpl::TryToStart. Because of the way the keyboard suppression

works, before TryToStart is called, the suppression mechanism was making

sure it only triggered if `FCClientImpl::IsSupported` is true. This

means that we only recorded the metric in successful cases.



After this CL, the metric is recorded as part of the process that checks

whether FC can be triggered at all.



Bug: 1469328

entry.title: Multiplanar: Fix external sampler support in service side
entry.content:
This change fixes some support for external sampler in shared image

service side util methods and SkiaGLImageRepresentation. For the

ToClosestSkColorTypeExternalSampler we add support for multiplanar

formats with external sampler whereas in

ToGLFormatDescExternalSampler the storage format is sized.

SkiaGLImageRepresentation gets the correct GL desc before using its

storage internal format

entry.title: [Profile DragDrop] React to drag enter and perform initial shift
entry.content:
On drag enter, we compute the index of the tile that was entered, then

perform a shift of all the tiles between the start tile index and the

entered tile index.

The shift is done through a transform XY translation with an animation.

entry.title: Refer to the viewport's width correctly
entry.content:
In the HTMLMetaThemeColorOverridesManifest test, the

viewport's width has been referred to using the

outerWidth value [0], until now. However, the actual

property that designates the width is innerWidth [1].



Without this patch, the test's result could be changed

depending on the irrelevant browser UI, such as sidebars.



[0]

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/outerWidth



[1]

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/innerWidth





Bug: none

entry.title: Revert "Omit frame pointers in Skia's Raster Pipeline"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 6de2d1b943a346e0e5211e6307fe93f9d2c9155e.



Reason for revert: Experimental backout to monitor perf changes



Original change's description:

> Omit frame pointers in Skia's Raster Pipeline

>

> Skia's RP performs CPU shading with a series of tail-called

> "stages". Each stage is relatively short - often just a few

> instructions. In this system, the frame-pointer overhead is

> significant. We've shown this in Skia benchmarks, and would

> like to measure the impact on Chrome's rendering speed.

>

> We propose landing, then reverting this CL. Pinpoint will

> detect any regressions. Depending on the outcome of that,

> we can assess the value of landing this permanently.

>

> Bug: 1409835

> Change-Id: I9a4f24c30de0df829bf6a468e0793e1446e59b3e

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4739492

> Reviewed-by: Herb Derby

> Commit-Queue: Brian Osman

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1178019}

entry.title: Revert "dlp: Show desktop notif. when all files apps close"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 101c7b25fe135948e411418c4f706790465e0778.



Reason for revert: Suspected to trigger/be involved in MSAN failures in https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/37557/overview.



Original change's description:

> dlp: Show desktop notif. when all files apps close

>

> Ensures that any opened DLP panel items are moved to a desktop (system)

> notification, in case all Files app windows close:

> * Changes `IOTask::IsPaused()` to include tasks paused by DLP warning

> * This then works because `IOTaskController::ProgressPausedTasks()`

> force-sends a status update and the desktop notification is shown.

> * For error notifications, i.e. when the task is blocked by DLP, we

> don't track the task anymore in the controller, but we do have all the

> info in `FilesPolicyNotificationManager`

> * Adds a function in FPNM to loop over tracked IOTasks and show the

> notifications for those with errors.

> * Calls this function in the `FileManagerUI` dtor, when the last

> instance is being destroyed.

>

> The only case not covered is the timeout notification, as when this is

> visible, the `FPNM` also doesn't track the task anymore, but it could

> be fixed. However, it requires more changes in `FPNM` so will be done

> in a separate CL if needed.

>

> R=lucmult@chromium.org,chromeos-dlp@google.com

>

> Bug: b:290903069

> Change-Id: Ia66cbbaa12a8911235dd02eafd4b4bedf4ccc5b0

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4711968

entry.title: Revert "Move ownership of CrdAdminSessionController up"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 90246d75cfa97bd8460e5b96e769755dda3b9640.



Reason for revert: Suspected to cause build failures on Libfuzzer Upload Chrome OS ASan, compare https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Libfuzzer%20Upload%20Chrome%20OS%20ASan/103558/overview



Original change's description:

> Move ownership of CrdAdminSessionController up

>

> Previously it was owned by the DeviceCommandsFactoryAsh,

> which has always been a bit of a convenience choice and not really a

> deliberate design,

> so this CL moves it up to BrowserPolicyConnectorAsh, which is a more

> logical parent since it already owns lots of components required for

> the device cloud policy implementation.

>

> Other changes in this CL:

> * Move `DeviceCommandStartCrdSessionJob::Delegate` to a stand-alone

> class `StartCrdSessionJobDelegate`, as that makes passing this

> delegate along easier (since you can not forward declare nested

> classes).

> * Remove dependency of `DeviceCommandFactoryAsh` on

> `DeviceCloudPolicyManagerAsh` (since it only needed a single field

> of that class).

>

> Bug: b:283091619

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Check that the Fragment is set for the right View
entry.content:
This is a speculative fix for the crash that happens when the

FragmentManager can't find the FragmentContainerView that should

hold the PasswordMigrationWarningIntroFragment.

The hypothesis is that the FragmentContainerView seems to be visible

because it's inflated, but it was not yet added to the View hierarchy

so the FragmentManager of the Activity can't yet find it at the moment

when setFragment() is called.

entry.title: [css-logical] Resolve logical values of 'resize' with the element itself
entry.content:
The 'resize' CSS property was resolving logical values using the writing mode of the containing block. This patch changes it to use the writing

mode of the element itself, as resolved by the CSS Working Group in

https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/3281



There is no compat risk since these values are disabled behind a flag.
